titles.title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 10 Main Street in East Rockaway, New York, as the "John J. Cook Post Office".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform. (text of measure as introduced: CR 11/14/2011 H7409)

committee.name: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform. (text of measure as introduced: CR 11/14/2011 H7409)

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Workforce, U.S. Postal Service, and Labor Policy .

committee.name: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform. (text of measure as introduced: CR 11/14/2011 H7409)

action.text: Subcommittee on Federal Workforce, U.S. Postal Service, and Labor Policy Discharged.

committee.name: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform. (text of measure as introduced: CR 11/14/2011 H7409)

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform. (text of measure as introduced: CR 11/14/2011 H7409)

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Mr. Kelly moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2079.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 418 - 2 (Roll no. 52). (text: CR 02/14/2012 H705)

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

committee.name: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform. (text of measure as introduced: CR 11/14/2011 H7409)

action.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs referred to Subcommittee on Federal Financial Management, Government Information, Federal Services, and International Security.

committee.name: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform. (text of measure as introduced: CR 11/14/2011 H7409)

calendar.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Lieberman without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 373.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: House Oversight and Government Reform
committee.subcommittee: Federal Workforce, U.S. Postal Service, and Labor Policy

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
committee.subcommittee: Federal Financial Management, Government Information, Federal Services, and International Security

bill.summary: 5/15/2012--Public Law. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.) Designates the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 10 Main Street in East Rockaway, New York, as the "John J. Cook Post Office."
